description: From Dutch boedel. Doublet of bottle.

entries.meaning: (slang) Money, especially when acquired or spent illegally or improperly; swag.
examples: He was your 'man higher up' when you were on the force. His share of the boodle passed through your hands. You must go on the stand and testify against him.

entries.meaning: (US, dialect) The whole collection or lot; caboodle.

verbs.description: boodle (third-person singular simple present boodles, present participle boodling, simple past and past participle boodled)
